Key Match Events: Giancarlo Stanton hit a solo home run in the eighth inning to lift the Yankees to a 3-2 win over the Royals.
Stanton went 3-for-4 and added an RBI double to his game-winning homer.
The Yankees bullpen tossed 4 ¹/₃ shutout innings in relief of Clarke Schmidt.
Clay Holmes and Tommy Kahnle each recorded four outs before Luke Weaver nailed down five for the save.
Pre-Game Insights: Stanton took extra batting practice off a pitching machine to see the hitting backdrop and how the ball flew off high velocity.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Aaron Boone praised Stanton's ability to focus in big moments.
Stanton expressed his satisfaction with his postseason success, emphasizing the importance of continuous effort.
Aaron Judge appreciated Stanton's stolen base, highlighting its significance in getting into scoring position.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The sellout crowd at Kauffman Stadium was amped up for its first playoff game in nine years.
The Yankees struggled with runners in scoring position, going 0-for-6 in the game and 3-for-25 in the series.
